item.title: The Woman in the Coldplay Concert Kiss Cam Video Is Ready to Talk
item.description: Kristin Cabot was caught on camera with her boss at a concert. The video went viral. Soon she was drowning in the vitriol of strangers.
item.dc:creator: Lisa Miller
item.media:credit: Greta Rybus for The New York Times
item.media:description: “You can make mistakes, and you can really screw up. But you don’t have to be threatened to be killed for them.”

item.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene, Donald Trump Jr. and More Conservative Figures Announce Their Engagements
item.description: Several prominent conservative figures have announced that they are engaged this week, news often celebrated by President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Jesse McKinley
item.media:description: Donald Trump Jr. confirmed his engagement this week to Bettina Anderson, a Florida influencer and Palm Beach socialite.

item.title: Timothée Chalamet, Gwyneth Paltrow and Zohran Mamdani Toast ‘Marty Supreme’
item.description: With orange beanies, a roast pig and a mayor-elect, the New York premiere of A24’s buzzy Ping-Pong film was its own kind of flick.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Bahr and Nina Westervelt
item.media:credit: Nina Westervelt for The New York Times

item.title: Why Can’t We Leave the Necktie Alone?
item.description: Bizarre attempts to revive the necktie are leaving us cold.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher
item.media:description: This winter’s most inexplicable fashion accessory: the unattached necktie.

item.title: Fighting for Femininity, Not Feminism on the New Women’s Right
item.description: A group of young conservatives feel that the pressures they face as 20-something women have been made worse by the liberal feminism that defined their youth.
item.dc:creator: Emma Goldberg

item.title: Your Holiday Dilemmas, Solved!
item.description: Our columnist offers guidance on holiday travel, gift exchanges and seasonal hospitality. (Must it extend to electric vehicle charging?)
item.dc:creator: Philip Galanes

item.title: The 67 Most Stylish People of 2025
item.description: They appeared on courts and carpets, stages and sidelines, screens big and small. And they all shaped notions of style and self-expression.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk

item.title: James Cameron Tempers His Temper and Channels His Inner Na’vi
item.description: Years after his Titanic tantrums, the “Avatar” director has “mellowed,” says Sigourney Weaver. He calls it “marinating.”
item.dc:creator: Maureen Dowd
item.media:credit: JJ Geiger for The New York Times

item.title: Sparks Flew in Their ‘Rave Crew’ Group Chat
item.description: Prakhar Gupta, a podcaster from India, was intrigued when Claudia Robles-Gil, an artist from Mexico City, joined his friend group.
item.dc:creator: Valeriya Safronova

item.title: Learning About Her Culture Until it Was No Longer Greek to Him
item.description: Irene Zahariadis was moments from deleting Hinge when she matched with Kevin Walker. It wasn’t long before he was helping roast a goat.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Block

item.title: She Traded Her Beach Vibes for Chickens and Chestnuts
item.description: Michael Craver and Simone Gaillard knew instantly they wanted to be together. Less certain was whether she’d be interested in his farmhouse.
item.dc:creator: Tammy LaGorce

item.title: When a Performer Met a Playwright
item.description: Like the characters in “When Harry Met Sally …” a film Grace Aki loves, she and F Haynie had a tepid start, and eventually, a romance.
item.dc:creator: Valeriya Safronova

item.title: The Revenge of the People Pleaser
item.description: After being assaulted, I worked for years to make myself invisible. Ryan saw me anyway.
item.dc:creator: Kimberley Falk

item.title: Sue Bender, Who Wrote About Living With the Amish, Dies at 91
item.description: “Plain and Simple,” her best-selling 1989 book, was a go-to text of the anti-materialist movement known as voluntary simplicity.
item.dc:creator: Trip Gabriel

item.title: The Meaning of Luigi Mangione’s New Suits
item.description: In court before his trial for killing the chief executive of UnitedHealthcare, Mr. Mangione tried out a different look.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman
item.media:description: Mr. Mangione alongside his attorney, Karen Friedman Agnifilo, during an evidentiary hearing on Dec. 12.

item.title: Sleep Cots and Graham Crackers at Elon Musk’s Child Care Program
item.description: Mr. Musk has ambitions to remake education, but his latest effort to open an elementary school in Texas appears to have faltered.
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Grind and Sheera Frenkel

item.title: How Do I Navigate Divorced Parents Over the Holidays?
item.description: Our Ask the Therapist columnist, Lori Gottlieb, advises a reader who tries to balance the needs of her divorced parents — but often ends up in tears.
item.dc:creator: Lori Gottlieb

item.title: When Your Family Is Estranged During the Holidays
item.description: Familial feuds have ripple effects, experts say.
item.dc:creator: Catherine Pearson

item.title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘Good Riddance, Christmas’
item.description: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.

item.title: I Cashed Out My 401(k) to Build a Women-Only Retirement Community
item.description: The Bird’s Nest is experimenting with a different way to age.
item.dc:creator: Anna Martin, Reva Goldberg, Emily Lang, Davis Land, Amy Pearl, Sara Curtis, Elisa Gutierrez, Jen Poyant, Lynn Levy, Daniel Ramirez, Dan Powell, Sonia Herrero, Rowan Niemisto and Marion Lozano

item.title: Street Style Look of the Week: A Bright Red Coat
item.description: Red outerwear (and like-colored socks) cheered up an ensemble spotted in Tokyo.
item.dc:creator: Simbarashe Cha

item.title: Bhavitha Mandava Was Discovered on the Subway. Then She Walked a Chanel Runway.
item.description: After Bhavitha Mandava appeared in the luxury house’s latest show, she became the most talked-about model of the season. She’s as surprised about it as everyone else.
item.dc:creator: Alisha Haridasani Gupta

item.title: How Steven Smith, Former Yeezy Designer for Kanye West, Is Remaking Crocs
item.description: Steven Smith worked for Yeezy, New Balance and Nike, where he created some of the most famous sneakers of all time. Now he’s making foam clogs.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher
item.media:credit: Martina Tuaty for The New York Times
item.media:description: Steven Smith, a futuristic, Syd Mead-esque footwear designer, joined Crocs last year. His first design for the brand, the Ripple clog, is covered in swoops and swirls.

item.title: The 52 Best Breakup Lines (Said in Real Life)
item.description: To mark the winter holidays — an especially popular time to break up — we asked people around the world for their most striking parting words to each other.
item.dc:creator: Miya Lee, Daniel Jones and Brian Rea

item.title: Confirm or Deny: James Cameron Edition
item.description: The box office king sits for a lightning-round interview.
item.dc:creator: Maureen Dowd
item.media:credit: JJ Geiger for The New York Times
item.media:description: He has an explanation for his “King of the World” statement.

item.title: NYC Snow Days From Past Blizzards Captured in Photos
item.description: Few things are as magical as waking up to a city wrapped in snow.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Giles

item.title: The Young Conservatives Fixated on H-1B Visas
item.description: For some Gen Z conservatives, H-1B visas are a hot new topic.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Taylor Pemberton
item.media:description: Young conservatives in the America First wing have fixated on the visa program as they grow disillusioned with the president’s promises on immigration and frustrated with the job market.

item.title: Woody Allen Is Not Sorry About His Friendship With Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: The nonagenarian director is taking a slightly different tack than many of the other powerful people associated with the disgraced former financier.
item.dc:creator: Ginia Bellafante
item.media:credit: Agence France-Presse, via House Oversight Committee Democrats
item.media:description: An image released by the House Oversight Democrats showing Jeffrey Epstein with Woody Allen.

item.title: My Boss Got Way Too Drunk at the Christmas Party
item.description: And now I’m dealing with the consequences.
item.dc:creator: Max Read
item.media:credit: Photo illustration by Margeaux Walter for The New York Times

item.title: Amid Fractures on the Right, Tucker Carlson Continues His Attacks
item.description: On Theo Von’s show this week, Mr. Carlson lashed out at a major supporter of the president, the F.B.I. and “unimpressive, dumb, totally noncreative people” leading the nation.
item.dc:creator: Jesse McKinley
item.media:credit: Patrick T. Fallon/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
item.media:description: Tucker Carlson did not mention President Trump by name in his attacks on Theo Von’s podcast, but his broadsides were the latest evidence of a deepening divide in Republican politics.

item.title: Phil Upchurch, Jazz Guitarist and Sideman to Stars, Dies at 84
item.description: A self-taught session man extraordinaire, he played with a constellation of stars, including Michael Jackson, Curtis Mayfield, Chaka Khan and Dizzy Gillespie.
item.dc:creator: Alex Williams
item.media:description: Phil Upchurch in 1983, playing at the North Sea Jazz Festival in The Hague. Although he was known for his versatility across multiple genres, he considered himself a jazz player — albeit one with his own vision.

item.title: Paul Grimstad, a Yale Professor, Is in “One Battle After Another” and “Marty Supreme"
item.description: Paul Grimstad has somehow found himself acting in “One Battle After Another” and “Marty Supreme,” two films headed to an Oscars collision course.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher
item.media:credit: Luis Manuel Diaz for The New York Times
item.media:description: “I love teaching,” said Mr. Grimstad. “I love being in the mix with the students and talking about books.”

item.title: Fleece, Love and Vomit: New Yorkers’ Best (and Worst) SantaCon Stories
item.description: The bar crawl and charity fund-raiser has been eliciting strong reactions in the city for more than 25 years. Readers shared theirs.
item.dc:creator: Callie Holtermann
